column4: Odd ubuntu question - how come synaptic doesn't pickup the system fonts I have defined (located in .fonts) - but uses the default sans fonts.. All the other apps use the right fonts (for menus, display, etc...)
when you gksudo something it uses whatever the root user has defined for fonts and colors, so it won't use your themes or fonts
I can of course just make a symbolic link in root to my user fonts which should solve it :)
